授業方法: No textbook is used.  Students will be given reading materials either in print or via the Internet at least one week in advance. They must read all of the assigned readings before attending lectures or seminars.  (For those who are interested in further readings, a list of advanced readings is provided.  These are not required readings but provide the students with the opportunity to deepen their understanding of the subject and will be useful references for further studies.)  Students will be given different reading assignments according to their interest, the level of their study, discipline and credit transfer requirements.

トピック.授業外学習2: Participation in special seminars to be held from 13.30 till 15.00 on Wed. is required. The course is structured around lectures and seminars. Each participant is to critically present a book chapter or a journal article in addition to a case study in the class. The case study should be submitted as their final report. Students must obtain approval for presentation topics, and agree upon time slots for the presentations from the instructor within the first two weeks of the course. In addition to regular classes, a visitor’s session will be included if salient opportunities arise.  This is a seminar course.  Students who fail to attend more than 20% of the classes will not be passed without evidence of extraneous circumstances.
